clinical.translation[0].definitions[0].d: relating to treating or testing people who are sick
clinical.translation[0].definitions[0].n: clinical medicine/experience/training etc (=medicine etc that deals directly with people, rather than with research or ideas)
clinical.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The drug has undergone extensive clinical trials  (=tests to see if it is effective in treating people).
The therapy has helped people with clinical depression  (=a strong feeling of sadness, for which you need medical help).
clinical.translation[0].definitions[1].d: relating to a hospital or clinic
clinical.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The program gives the students experience in a clinical setting.
clinical.translation[0].definitions[2].d: considering only the facts and not influenced by personal feelings
clinical.translation[0].definitions[2].e: A formal marriage agreement sounds clinical, but it can be a good idea.
clinical.translation[0].definitions[3].d: a clinical building or room is very plain and clean, but not attractive or comfortable
clinical.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The walls were painted a clinical white.
